title: How to Make a Sticking Out Picture

steps.headline: Take a piece of cardboard roughly the size of a small book.
Keep the cardboard flat and neat, and cover the front and the back with clean paper.
steps.description: Remember to keep it very neat and tidy.

steps.headline: Take another piece of cardboard.
steps.description: Using a marker or felt-pen, draw weeds, starfishes, rocks and loads of fish.

steps.headline: Cut them out neatly, making sure that you show the outlines.
Turn to the flat piece of cardboard covered neatly by paper.
steps.description: Color it using crayon, water or poster color. Add some tiny details, like shades and the sun shining through the water (remember, you can do any kind of theme. I am taking an "underwater scene" here.)

steps.headline: Stick tiny pieces of cardboard box card behind your fish, weeds, etc.
steps.description: Stick them (with the pieces behind them) to the colored cardboard.

steps.headline: Flip it over after drying.
steps.description: Color the front with the theme's name (here; "Underwater scene")

text: Take a piece of cardboard roughly the size of a small book.  Decide what theme you want. Let's take an under-water world. Keep the cardboard flat and neat, and cover the front and the back with clean paper. Remember to keep it very neat and tidy. Take another piece of cardboard. Using a marker or felt-pen, draw weeds, starfishes, rocks and loads of fish. Cut them out neatly, making sure that you show the outlines.  Turn to the flat piece of cardboard covered neatly by paper. Color it using crayon, water or poster color. Add some tiny details, like shades and the sun shining through the water (remember, you can do any kind of theme. I am taking an "underwater scene" here.) Color the fish, rocks, etc. neatly. Stick tiny pieces of cardboard box card behind your fish, weeds, etc. Stick them (with the pieces behind them) to the colored cardboard. Flip it over after drying. Color the front with the theme's name (here; "Underwater scene") Fold it like a book.  Enjoy!
